title: Why is cooling necessary for the brake drum of a motor? - Quora

response.answer_text: The friction of braking makes brake dum of the motor very hot which involves a lot of heat loss and decreases a little bit of efficiency of the brakes, so in order for smooth braking we require it.

Prolonged braking heats up your brake drum and causes what is called “Brake fade”. Brake linings lose their braking effectiveness at higher temperature. Therefore cooling becomes vital for continued brake performance. Reference Brake fade - Wikipedia
